glossary.etpDescription: This data is used to calculate carbon intensities (kgCO₂e/employee).
glossary.caDescription: This data is used to calculate carbon intensities (kgCO₂e/{unit} CA). Please note that the budget must be entered in thousands of euros (k€).
glossary.volunteerDescription: The number of volunteers entered here will simply be used to calculate the carbon intensity per volunteer, in tCO₂e/volunteer. You can enter the number of volunteers, the number of active volunteers, whether or not to count members of the Board of Directors, etc. The most important thing is not how you choose to count volunteers, but that you use the same method for your future Carbon Footprint® assessments so that you can compare changes in your emissions with changes in your organisation's activities.

flow.info: You can download a sample flow mapping to help you build your own. Afterwards, if you wish to submit your flow mapping so that other users can use it as an example and help other associations, please send it to <mail>methodologie@abc-transitionbascarbone.fr</mail>

dependencyMatrix.info: You can download a sample risk and dependency matrix to help you build your own. Afterwards, if you wish to submit your own matrix to help other associations by providing a working base, please send it to <mail>methodologie@abc-transitionbascarbone.fr</mail>
